intro: Astragalus marinus subsp. boreomarinus, commonly known as the Arctic milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure and small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being narrow and hairy. Astragalus marinus subsp. boreomarinus plays a role in stabilizing coastal and tundra soils and is an important part of the local flora in its native habitat.
